content: I give free trading signals for the E mini S&P asset, for who may be interested.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: styleyfrancky on August 08, 2022, 05:36:02 PMI give free trading signals for the E mini S&P asset, for who may be interested. Here is my last stat: https://trader.ftmo.com/metrix?share=97ef9ede3c45&lang=enFeel free to let me know if you're interested.If it is free signal, why requesting from people to let you know if they are interested, you can post your free signal on this your thread directly so that everyone can see how good you are.My advice for people is to never trust trading signals, free or paid. People should abstain from paying for signals too. There is nothing better to learn trading because anyone can be a scam victim at anytime.

Here is my last stat:Feel free to let me know if you're interested.Quote from: styleyfrancky on August 08, 2022, 07:31:51 PMSell nowInteresting, first you say you are giving away free signals, a few hours later you are selling them. Doesn't look odd at all, but whatever.If you are really interested in providing trading knowledge for free, open a transparent thread here in the forum and address possible criticisms/suggestions. Then, if you can show an appropriate track record, you may eventually start charging money for your analysis. Currently, however, it just looks shady and that's why I can only advise everyone to think twice before burning their money here. /edit: Looks like you edited your post. Another red flag. Hm.And:

Hm.And:https://i.imgur.com/x09fT0X.pngHahaha, no, sell now, s&p 500, the trade!  And yes, I edit it just to test the forum's features, it's been a while I didn't post anything on a forum, and especially here. Chill out dude, I have done no harm up until now  Yes, I may have plan to be paid for my signals later, but I'll share them for free for now, so calm down  you'll see by yourself if I'm a fraud or guenuine, both with my signals' validity, and the evolution of my ftmo demo account.

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: bullrun2020bro on August 08, 2022, 07:40:59 PMInteresting, first you say you are giving away free signals, a few hours later you are selling them. Doesn't look odd at all, but whatever.Usually, all of those people who come to announce to provide free signals have the intention to start a premium paid signal service, once they hit a few successful signals. Usually, these people will give you 4 -5 signals per day, and even if one or two signals get hit, they will create so much hype and force you to join their premium service. Therefore I usually avoid these unknown signal groups.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: bullrun2020bro on August 08, 2022, 07:40:59 PMInteresting, first you say you are giving away free signals, a few hours later you are selling them. Doesn't look odd at all, but whatever.Anyone that says he wants to give free signal will end up demanding money from people, that is why none of them want to provide any signal on this forum, because they want people do pay money and if they request for that directly on this forum, they will be rejected, also because anyone can provide signal, they do not care if the signal go wrong or not, if that happens on this forum, people will easily know how wrong signals can also be. I always advice newbies to avoid both free and paying signals, the best is to learn trading from scratch.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: Quote from: styleyfrancky on August 08, 2022, 05:36:02 PMI give free trading signals for the E mini S&P asset, for who may be interested. Here is my last stat: https://trader.ftmo.com/metrix?share=97ef9ede3c45&lang=enFeel free to let me know if you're interested.I guess if that link is a referral link that you want to share with us because I check on ftmo dot com, I see that they are almost similar to a trading broker, which offers their skills to people who want to trade. I read on their ftmo.com/en/why-ftmo-challenge/ page, wherein I see "One-time fee only (no recurrent charges or other fees)," so I assume that we need to pay to use their services.The subscription fee is about €155.00, which is too high. Besides that, the trade is for stock, not crypto, while we are in the crypto forum.

Ratimov, you are totally right, but I don't have the funds to trade by myself for now, so I said to myself why not sharing my trading entries for now. I really understand your suspicion with all of the scams out there, but I act through a clean and sincere approach hereTrade update: TP1 reached

Usually, these people will give you 4 -5 signals per day, and even if one or two signals get hit, they will create so much hype and force you to join their premium service. Therefore I usually avoid these unknown signal groups.that's how all predictors work, sometimes they have to get lucky then they base the whole signal resale business on a little luck.I always find it interesting to see that despite such skill, they don't have their own money for trading.Thank you very much, but I would maybe continue providing signals, as I want.  I'm aware after these 5 years of struggle to find a way to get profitable that trading may be difficult, so if I can help the community by any means. Then, just for information, it's been 4 months now that I'm profitable, so I guess it's not so anymore about "luck". And I understand the critics about being profitable and not having funds. But It's easy to judge. With a different point of view, you can think about a job lost, unemployement, etc... For now, really, I'm here to help  people can consider my free signals or move on,everyone does as he wants
